titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 22) to reform the postal laws of the United States.
Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 22) to reform the postal laws of the United States.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 109-184, by Mr. Sessions.

Rule provides for consideration of H.R. 22 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions except motion to recommit with or without instructions. Measure will be considered read. Specified amendments are in order.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 66.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 380.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 22) to reform the postal laws of the United States.
